title: Grade 7
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

8AC46FEDC78A4CB4B01D88E600640F03.description: Use general academic and domain-specific words and phrases across contexts.

B9AA0B108DB24CEFBABBDEE997D449FD.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

B17876F34CA447E6BD9F6970EA51D750.description: Demonstrate understanding of synonyms and antonyms.

E468B5053EC34DF9AEC52CED99134442.description: Identify the literal and nonliteral meanings of words in context.

EAD6CEFB333A414DAEDB70F156AA5727.description: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and use.

DE8983AF4F9747A4BD6428A26C4682CE.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

2B321C4C89D249BDB034519AE11484F7.description: Demonstrate knowledge of word meanings drawn from grade 7 content using context clues.

FE6F72F1B3D14940A75452C88BA66D00.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

817634BF82E844808D22EDF054EF8318.description: Use precise language to achieve desired outcomes or meaning when communicating.

CBC36DCC270B4AF4837DC25143FAB0A7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

C2D68C3A41EE40DE987C026AAF244F42.description: Demonstrate understanding of conventions of standard English within 6-8 conventions continuum when writing.

0010DBC68504420B897273E84752952C.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

1C56E052EC9440B5973D3165E1199853.description: Demonstrate standard English grammar and usage within the 6-8 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

AB41BB589FF34CF1A4A3E3F623712F23.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

B5B43A0564B142B19E3D8D86EA607747.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

F1F2B77ACFCE4479A78DDE168B9E0C0D.description: Select or create audio recordings and visual/tactile displays to emphasize specific points in a presentation.

B6A2DC02EED54ED79CCC328D086B8302.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

CB699F5721FC482B8FA00928AE247ECB.description: Communicate findings including descriptions, facts, or details related to main idea or theme.

972DF9550BD64712A05F8E27A66B323B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

34814A01681141CAB83AE06EB6F05B63.description: Determine whether the claims made by a speaker are fact or opinion.

AA05AB9D9E394CB09E32C09F38D3BBD0.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

54D42023EEE54990B1732D3DF2815F6F.description: Identify details related to the main idea of a text presented orally or through other media.

B750E9D5E3DA4C168FF3AC1872A952E7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

17BEC2BA2AEF49A0966467667577D007.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others in a discussion.

661856FA27364F429C8959A676EEF5F7.description: Remain on the topic of the discussion when answering questions or making other contributions to a discussion.

D2C915C76F874723A404A00E87A57653.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, follow simple, agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.

7D4AC2BC572440CD9D14ACB3BC576928.description: Come to discussions prepared to share information.

C131CDF099074CEEAF27BA6CC9E06716.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

88379B7D74D14722813D75398E461E71.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

138945A8F8904066AF8052DD5F7614DB.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

61DE83F69A164C50A396C323A8105AA7.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

CB7D68FE27504BFA9752315048C4A18E.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

F9D5DF048D8A4053A09E41633FCC7A87.description: Identify quotes providing relevant information about a topic from multiple print or digital sources.

44B20D37E5064A0585E711FE2F430568.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

7A47E5BB5CCE49CF9DFC0848D5949222.description: Conduct research to answer a question based on multiple sources of information.

9BD0BF7147144ACFA2775BC53650AFA3.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

C8B464D4AB7247018985521DEC9A2D7B.description: Use digital tools to produce writing to interacting and collaborating with others.

A828F6CB34F54DB38EC59629F671A042.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

4D7BCFF0DB2345408AD15F260B584A19.description: Use words that describe feelings of people or characters in the narrative.

4F88DE26A94243B4BD7A315ECEC8827A.description: Use temporal words (e.g., first, then, next) to signal order.

8EAC685F93C34A7D8CC8F60D00F04C08.description: Write a narrative about a real or imagined experience introducing the experience, at least one character, and two or more events.

6F67D0D4D71648249A5BDA1AA53F895C.description: Write about events or personal experiences.

D2A9295669AE48C9A5A8D2E823C1C3A4.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

2C8AFB0FFE6C44CA969110102B0AA919.description: Select domain-specific vocabulary to use in writing about the topic.

E940399B48AE4E1091B09CCAA2F19E32.description: Provide facts, details, or other information related to the topic.

7E2F9B64BEBB40A2A98B2C641D40829E.description: Introduce a topic and write to convey ideas and information about it including visual, tactual, or multimedia information as appropriate.

533D6ED5286D4F67A56064F3CD6EB5EE.description: Write to share information supported by details.

B3F31262D2FE4E23B929236A5B8FBF80.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

027AEC1DCC264C10A2CD39A014D9F98A.description: Use temporal words (first, next, also) to create connections.

CF3D36289AEB4B1196ECF96201D30E47.description: Write one or more reasons to support a claim about a topic or text.

68B2DEC558194057A774A3FBFC17886F.description: Introduce a topic or text and write one claim about it.

BE06C98A43DC40539CE396119CBA4EA6.description: Write claims about topics or texts.

334C0EB7AF604283829ED3D02963942A.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

8F11FCCF261C454E92A3B5C4F110E11B.description:
Actively engage in reading of information text for sustained periods of time for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to
text.

96F3D4E0235B42FB80062B63BEB65EA6.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

7BE0CD4A885C437BAE228C8D030EEDD1.description: Compare the information presented in texts by different authors on the same topic

68D79A720C7442DA9710AFEB41B9DFA0.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

09D1F981487C4AD4BC532A8F44D8D4BD.description: Analyze text to identify evidence that supports claims made in the text.

08F724355B71481B92F02CA67DF07839.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

FDAE05B8E6C44163A5CFE646E2B194A9.description: Compare a text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the same text.

1195BCA1F66F4FB0995A7597C6B731B8.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

9EB70F2A201E4A91834F0F4E42624C49.description: Identify words or phrases in the text that describe or show the author’s point of view.

AF05FD91750D4E508758340BF3E4E520.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

04596AF7BA5545C3B59E38A235B4883C.description: Determine how a fact, step, or event fits into the overall structure of the text.

0C66206F718942938CC02529A97EC513.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

6953ADF26C9640EA825F54D93C1B84E7.description: Determine how words or phrases are used to persuade or inform a text.

07B5FED140024356AFF0ABBE0FFCBC11.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

66AB63080B934C4CB9B77E61A54606BA.description: Determine how two individuals, events, or ideas in a text are related.

8AC0726F99494657A10662F85114F6E3.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

091B7C6AD2214ABCA059DC515C331926.description: Determine two or more central ideas in a text.

6F4C16165BE546C486E51D24A0805E0B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

0AE429CC5ABC4A37B5E02AD27323CE0C.description: Analyze text to identify where information is explicitly stated and where inferences must be drawn.

8D32B66B580C4F769A99EC8F002FE939.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

22D4569804604728A17CE9E0583F714D.description: Actively engage in reading for the purpose of connecting prior knowledge and experiences to text for sustained periods of time."

D154D84E5BFC4C3097768D4E58335724.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

F703805D690C4022BEACF97C48D5B13A.description: Compare a fictional character in a text with the same character portrayed in a historical account.

0E739EA488A3455C90912068A08B5E50.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

13512715710C4A178E68B2618B615808.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

2F35C67356CF404091FBECE3E2648C93.description: Compare a text version of a story or poem with a video or live version of the same text.

CADF89D62155465BA0AE8B832AAA3928.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

4EC319D9DEBB4CA68EAAE076D3828102.description: Compare the points of view of two or more characters or narrators in a text.

1224713D1276418F9235F695B77C940F.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

DE13F7324D62496EBA8C11D1DC2A9913.description: Differentiate between a poem and other types of text.

BE8985AD396449239F98961A538D7785.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

967B4831BA3A42CA89210D1EB0AB4E63.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text; determine how different word choices would change the meaning.

BEFF667C3D554C63AA8EBC18F894A2B5.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

C50855E6790C4AB8A234D342C622A177.description: Determine how two or more story elements are related.

7F8DDE0A50EA42FDBEC739D72E326C59.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

1764A01A6FAD4CF7B0F511DCBFC0E69B.description: Identify events in a text that are related to the theme.

07655537F063429F9FEF19F2CC6BCBF7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

A1FEBF05162B4577A9CC46D36982416F.description: Analyze text to identify where information is explicitly stated and where inferences must be drawn.

0F189A14131D408D838F8B48155E200B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
